ygData.subject: Mellifluous Motion
ygData.msgSnippet: I used it to help a Barbarian Shaman friend get past a guard blocking the door to the basement of High Keep.  Only time I ve used it, but glad I had it then!
ygData.messageBody:
I used it to help a Barbarian Shaman friend get past a guard blocking the
door to the basement of High Keep. Only time I've used it, but glad I had
it then!

>From: "Kyle" <ksibbald@...>
>
> I wouldn't say that Motion is totally useless. Saturday Night in Runnyeye
a
>group member got stuck in some boards near water. I memorized motion and
>blinked him out. COurse I blinked myself right into the boards but that's
>besides the point. Fortunately the group member was also a bard so he
>memorized it and blinked me underneath into the water. I then equipped my
>flute and blinked out down the passage.
> Sure we could have used a succor/evac, but we didn't want to waste the
time
>travelling all the way back.
>
> Good Journey,
>
> Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)

>8)
>8)The level 14 song DOES have a purpose. With many lore items,
>8)and even a few
>8)non-lore items you receive a message about the item. For
>8)instance, one ogre
>8)I happened upon once mentioned someone had given him a human
>8)head as a gift,
>8)and he wished to know whose it was. With that song I was
>8)able to tell him
>8)the name of the disgusting little pet head he carried around
>8)with him. The
>8)song is often useful for getting clues with quest items. I
>8)once found a key
>8)and used the song to tell me it was a High Hold Strongbox
>8)key. Many of the
>8)messages you get from items using this song have not been
>8)implemented yet
>8)(that's what pending lore means!). Bards get a song to learn the lore
>8)behind the item, and though the lore might often be
>8)pointless, of course
>8)bards should know it! So the song is good.
>8)
>8)Regardless, I use this song more often that Mellifluous
>8)Motion! Now THERE's
>8)a song I see no purpose for! It seems to function like the
>8)old D&D spell
>8)Blink, but for it to be useful at all I think it would need its pulses
>8)shortened. Otherwise it's just a joke-song, and often a
>8)cruel joke at that.
>8)
>8)Roop
